intro: Dasyphyllum sprengelianum var. inerme, commonly known as the slender dasyphyllum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are often followed by small, berry-like fruits. This species is often found in shaded, humid environments within tropical and subtropical forests.
